title: MS AccessAsc()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MS AccessAsc()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return the ASCII value of the first character in "CustomerName":
SELECT Asc(CustomerName) AS NumCodeOfFirstChar
FROM Customers;

Definition and Usage
The Asc() function returns the ASCII value for the specific character.
Syntax
Asc(
character
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
character
Required. The character to return the ASCII value for. If more than one 
    character is entered, it will only return the value for the first character
Technical Details
Works in:
From Access 2000

❯
★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:

FROM Customers;

summary: This tutorial covers MS AccessAsc()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MS AccessAsc()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MS AccessAsc()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
